creator: akineko@pacbell.net
text:
I had a setting to execute Python script as a CGI handler. > AddHandler cgi-script .py Now I created a document (not a script) which has .py.html as a file name. Somehow Apache 1.3.27 recognizes it as a executable script. HTML page (excerpt): winlvds.py - 'winlvds' control program
error_log (excerpt): > [Sun Feb 23 17:14:05 2003] [error] [client 192.168.1.2] file permissions deny server execution: /usr/local/apache/htdocs/intranet/pixim/winlvds.py.html // This problem disappeared when I commented out AddHandler cgi-script .py line. I don't know if this bug exists in Apache 2.x. Aki Niimura

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
No bug. Please read the mod_mime documentation:
<http://httpd.apache.org/docs/mod/mod_mime.html#multipleext>.

However, you can workaround it by adding
AddHandler text/html .html

or something like
<Files *.py.*>
RemoveHandler py
</Files>

(The latter is more clean, but the former is more efficient ;-)

Thanks for using Apache!
